description: INSTALLATION OF 1NO AIR SOURCE HEAT PUMP TO THE REAR
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Drawing No: 2024 OS 10004276 (Site Location Plan) Dated 24 September 2024 
Drawing No:02(Site Location of Heat Pump Plan as proposed) Dated 24 September 2024   
Drawing No 04(Proposed East Elevation Plan, Proposed South Elevation Plan, Proposed North Elevation Plan, And Proposed West Elevation Plan) Dated 24 September 2024 
Daikin Altherma 3 High-Capacity Monobloc
Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 4 - Due to potential impact on the surrounding locality from the development the noise criteria recommendations to protect noise impact on the noise sensitive properties  as specified in the Daikin Altherma 3 High Capacity Monobloc  shall be  implemented and maintained as a minimum standard. 

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of adjoining properties and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy CS14 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2, DM D3 & DM EP2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014 and the National Planning Policy Framework 2023 .
Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved without delay
